energy.title: Deforestation 101: Everything You Need to Know
energy.author: Cristen Hemingway Jaynes
energy.content_preview: Trees have been around for about 370 million years. Today, there are about three trillion trees and ten billion acres of forest on Earth. That may sound like a lot, but the planet has lost more than one billion acres of forest to deforestation since 1990.

energy.title: Climate Fintech Startup Atmos Financial Puts Savings to Work for Clean Energy
energy.author: Sylvia Beyer
energy.content_preview: Money doesn't just sit in savings accounts doing nothing. Banks recirculate deposited cash as loans — for cars, homes, even oil pipelines — and pay customers interest for the service.

energy.title: Climate Change Is Tightening Insurance Markets. That’s No Good for the Solar Industry
energy.author: Emma Foehringer Merchant
energy.content_preview: In the spring of 2019, the sky in parts of West Texas opened up, in some areas dropping hailstones as big as baseballs, according to the National Weather Service.

energy.title: So Big It’s Boring: The Rise of Utility-Scale Solar
energy.author: Colin Smith
energy.content_preview: In 2015, I was sitting with representatives of Strata Solar, Southern Company and the Arkansas Public Service Commission, waiting to go onstage. We were the last session of the last day of the conference in question — a tough time slot.

energy.title: Will Hydrogen Look Like Solar?
energy.author: Stephen Lacey
energy.content_preview: The road to solar glory has been littered with failed companies -- the ones you may know (Solyndra) and hundreds you probably do not. Will the burgeoning hydrogen space follow a similar bumpy road? Hydrogen is at a similar phase of market and technological maturity, with similar levels of hype.

energy.title: Where Green Hydrogen Is Headed
energy.author: GTM Creative Strategies
energy.content_preview: Suddenly everyone is talking about green hydrogen. From South Africa to the United Arab Emirates. From China to Utah. Governments and developers are eyeing hydrogen as a decarbonization tool. But the rush is also raising lots of questions: Where will hydrogen be most useful? How do you create a supply chain to support it?

transport.title: Why TransitTech Is So Vital to Struggling Public Transportation Systems
transport.author: Stephen Lacey
transport.content_preview: Ride sharing has swept transportation systems over the last decade -- bringing convenience, but also congestion, inequities, and political fights. Now a new category of transportation networking is emerging: TransitTech.
